The MRI shows a ring-enhancing lesion in the left temporal lobe. Aspiration and surgical drainage should be the next step in management to remove the abscess and prevent further damage to the brain. Antibiotics like ciprofloxacin and metronidazole can be used in combination with surgical management, but they alone will not be enough. Albendazole and pyrimethamine with sulfadiazine are used to treat parasitic infections, not brain abscesses.
